most_active_tickets.title: Pieces Copilot doesn't get the LTM info and shows a wrong date

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Inaccuracy and UI Bug with LTM
common_issues.description: Pieces Copilot inaccurately generates information when using LTM, potentially due to incorrect date/time context.  Users report unrelated topics in initial responses. Specifying context details, like lecture names, improves accuracy.  A UI bug displays "Last Thursday" as the context time, regardless of the actual time.

related_issues.title: Pieces Copilot doesn't get the LTM info and shows a wrong date
related_issues.text:
Pieces Copilot doesn't get the LTM info and shows a wrong date
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After I did all my work with LTM turned on, I used the `Start Copilot Chat` button in the **Workstream Activity** View of Pieces Desktop. I asked it to generate some quiz questions based on what I studied, and it started talking about a lot of unrelated topics, even when the context was provided. Though when I started a new chat based on the context again and became more specific with the details such as lecture name and number (that was the one and only thing in the context I started the conversation with), it did it correctly. Also, all this while, the context time showed Last Thursday so I think there is an UI bug too. 

**Context Image:**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ab732ff6-d195-4e81-a2af-6cee1e1d2032)

**Chat Image (Where it talks about unrelated topics):**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d6abd44-60a0-4f0c-9f8a-1cf1a887fd2e)

**Chat Image (Where it was fixed):**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c7d86c81-ba0e-4ec3-8e2f-49a326ac232a)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Issue with remote desktop
related_issues.text:
Issue with remote desktop
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I encountered this issue while trying to use the piece extension in my WSL. The piece's extension gives issues anytime I try to use it in the Ubuntu remote desktop environment. This is an image of the issue it shows. I already tried the troubleshooting method on your website by creating a new port but it still didn't work.

![issue](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dce2b29c-93cb-465c-8224-9d1b3ab795cc)

Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the Pieces Copilot LTM inaccuracy and UI bug as it has the highest frequency and activity level.
Investigate the root cause of the Pieces Copilot issue, including date/time context handling and the "Last Thursday" UI bug.
Review and update documentation or user guides regarding Pieces Copilot LTM usage to address the confusion around context specification.
Consider implementing input validation or clearer prompts for context details in the Pieces Copilot interface.
Monitor the impact of these fixes on support ticket volume and user satisfaction related to Pieces Copilot and LTM functionality.
While less frequent, address the remote desktop issue with the Pieces extension in WSL to improve the user experience on that platform as well
